snippet: Unimaginable not so long ago, students from the Afghanistan National Institute of Music are coming to the United States for a 13-day tour, including a Carnegie Hall performance.
abstract: Students from the Afghanistan National Institute of Music are coming to the United States for a 13-day tour, including a performance at Carnegie Hall; school, which provides instruments and instruction for street children, represents country's emergence from a long period in which the Taliban persecuted musicians and curtailed musical education.

byline.original: By ALISSA J. RUBIN and DANIEL J. WAKIN
byline.contributor: Alissa J. Rubin reported from Kabul, and Daniel J. Wakin from New York.

lead_paragraph: Unimaginable not so long ago, students from the Afghanistan National Institute of Music are coming to the United States for a 13-day tour, including a Carnegie Hall performance.

headline.seo: Afghanistan National Institute of Music Students to Tour U.S.
headline.main: How Do You Get to Carnegie Hall? Start in Kabul
headline.print_headline: How Do You Get to Carnegie Hall? Start in Kabul
